sentence: The emails show involvement by numerous MAGA crew, including Mark Finchem, a candidate for secretary of State in Arizona, which is terrifying because should he win, he would oversee elections in Arizona.
author: Rebekah Sager
title: Newly uncovered MAGA emails show a sinister conspiracy to refute Biden's win and bestow it on Trump

sentence: Within hours of Arizona state Rep. Mark Finchem (R) introducing his bill to “decertify” and “set aside” the 2020 election results in three of Arizona’s largest counties, two things happened.
author: Matt Shuham
title: Trump-Endorsed Arizona Secretary of State Candidate Has A Show Bill To ‘Decertify’ 2020

sentence: The other four individuals are Pennsylvania State Sen. Douglas Mastriano, Laura Cox, the former chair of the Michigan Republican Party, Arizona State Rep. Mark Finchem and Arizona Republican Party chair Kelli Ward.
author: Farnoush Amiri
title: Jan. 6 panel subpoenas 6 more in fake GOP electors scheme

author: Aaron McDade
title: Jan. 6 Committee Sends 6 New Subpoenas Focused on Fake Trump Electors

sentence: In addition two Arizonans were subpoenaed, Mark Finchem (R), a state House member running for secretary of state who attended the Jan. 6 protest in Washington, and Kelli Ward, the state Republican chair who sued to block committee efforts to obtain her phone records.
title: Jan 6 panel issues six new subpoenas

sentence: The subpoenas went to Arizona Republican Party Chairwoman Kelli Ward, a longtime Trump supporter, as well as Pennsylvania state Sen. Doug Mastriano, now running for governor there, and Arizona State House Rep. Mark Finchem, now running to be the next secretary of state in Arizona.
title: State officials pushing Trump alternate elector scheme come into focus

sentence: He was endorsing Mark Finchem, a Republican lawmaker from Tucson, in his bid to become Arizona’s secretary of state.
author: Ed Pilkington
title: ‘This should terrify the nation’: the Trump ally seeking to run Arizona’s elections

sentence: He also shared the link to a donation page titled "Rep Mark Finchem Legal Defense Fund" on the Christian crowdfunding site GiveSendGo.
author: Kelsey Vlamis
title: A Trump-backed candidate in Arizona is trying to raise $750,000 for a legal defense fund after he was subpoenaed by the January 6 committee

sentence: "In a Feb. 11 call, Boris Epshteyn, a lawyer and former special assistant to Trump, pointed again to baseless claims of widespread election fraud as he tried without success to rally support for a vote on a bill by state Republican Rep. Mark Finchem to set aside the results in three Arizona counties, Bowers told The Arizona Republic’s political podcast The Gaggle during a wide-ranging interview this week," the newspaper reported.
author: Bob Brigham
title: Trump ally pressed Arizona Republican to pass bill to erase 2020 election results: report

sentence: Some state legislators who had contacts with Giuliani as part of the scam have been subpoenaed by the panel, such as Mark Finchem in Arizona and Doug Mastriano in Pennsylvania, who are, respectively, running in 2022 to be secretary of state and governor in moves that raise fears of future attempts to subvert American democracy.
author: Peter Stone
title: Giuliani’s legal problems deepen as ‘false electors’ scheme investigated

sentence: Arizona state Rep. Mark Finchem asked the Department of Homeland Security to conduct "a full spectrum forensic examination" of voting machines" in the final weeks of the Trump presidency, and he got the attention of the department's acting director of the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency, reported Politico.
author: Travis Gettys
title: New emails reveal Trump allies’ effort to get DHS to conduct “forensic” probe of voting machines

sentence: Arizona state Rep. Mark Finchem asked the Department of Homeland Security to conduct “a full spectrum forensic examination” of voting machines" in the final weeks of the Trump presidency, and he got the attention of the department's acting director of the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency, reported Politico.

title: Trump allies secretly pushed DHS to help change the results of the 2020 election: report
